text: Daesang announced on Feb. 17 that it will increase sales in Indonesia by 1 trillion won within the next 10 years. Daesang’s sales in Indonesia reached 369.7 billion won in 2020, up 7 percent from 346.4 billion won in 2020. Daesang presented a blueprint for each of its business sectors to attain 1.4 trillion won in sales in 2030 and become one of the top 10 general food companies in Indonesia and a leading materials company in Southeast Asia. Daesang established PT. Miwon Indonesia in 1973, becoming the first Korean company to export a plant to an overseas country. It has since expanded its business to food and starch syrups in the Indonesian market. Daesang plans to diversify its business by developing new growth engines and steadily expand its business by ramping up food sales and expanding its main logistics center in Indonesia. In the biotech business, Daesang is pushing forward with a strategy to expand its production capacity through process automation and diversify its product portfolio by making new investments to produce functional amino acids. It is also planning to expand its sales base by actively targeting countries where Chinese MSG is not popular such as Japan and Taiwan. Never miss another article! title: Daesang to Increase Sales in Indonesia by 1 Tril. Won within 10 Years - Businesskorea
